definition: Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
surname Yan
Japanese variant of 顏|颜[yan2]
color/face/countenance
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)

sentences.english: The period's representative calligrapher was Yan Zhenqing.
This is a letter Yen Chenching wrote to a friend.
sentences.chinese: 这是颜真卿写给友人的书信。

sentences.english: The formation of Yan Zhenqing's calligraphy made the regular script considerable development in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 颜真卿书法艺术形成，使唐楷得到长足发展。

sentences.english: Yan lived in a poor family when he was young and had to practice calligraphy on the wall by using mud.
sentences.chinese: 颜真卿少时家贫缺纸笔，用笔醮黄土水在墙上练字。

sentences.english: This inscription was written by Yan Zhenqing, the great calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这个碑铭出自唐代大书法家颜真卿的手笔。

definition: Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Chu Suiliang (596-659), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Yu Shinan (558-638), politician of Sui and early Tang periods, poet and calligrapher, one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Zhong Yao (151-230), minister of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4] and noted calligrapher, said to have developed the regular script 楷書|楷书[kai3 shu1]
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
Xue Ji (649-713), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Yan Style (in Chinese calligraphy)
extant work of a calligrapher
grass script/cursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
running script/semicursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
